A: 1. What is the value of 9 in the number 983? (a) Thousand (b) Hundred (c) Tens
2. What is the value of 8 in the number 581? (a) Unit (b) Hundred (c) Tens
3. What is the value of 1 in the number 981? (a) Units (b) Tens (c) Hundreds
4. How many girls came to Ciara's party? (a) 12 (b) 6 (c) 3
5. How many boys were at the party? (a) 6 (b) 7 (c) 12
6. Half the boys wore black socks. How many was that? (a) 6 (b) 3 (c) 8
7. All the boys ate two sausages each. How many sausages was that? (a) 24 (b) 12 (c) 6
8. One-quarter of all Ciara's friends were 8 years old. How many children were 8 years old? (a) 6 (b) 3 (c) 2
9. The party finished at 5:00 p.m. How many minutes long was the party? (a) 60 (b) 90 (c) 120
10. One boy went home 30 minutes before the end of the party. At what time did he leave? (a) 3:30 (b) 4:30 (c) 4:35
11. I have 25k and 31k. How much have I altogether? (a) 66k (b) 56k (c) 65k
12. By how much is 45 greater than 39? (a) 6 (b) 14 (c) 16
13. Jim was 11 two years ago. What age is he now? (a) 9 (b) 13 (c) 22
